briefTitle: A Study to Determine the Safety and Efficacy of the RSV F Vaccine to Protect Infants Via Maternal Immunization
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Randomized, Observer-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Group-Sequential Study to Determine the Immunogenicity and Safety of a Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) F Nanoparticle Vaccine With Aluminum in Healthy Third-trimester Pregnant Women; and Safety and Efficacy of Maternally Transferred Antibodies in Preventing RSV Disease in Their Infants
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of maternal immunization during the third trimester of pregnancy with the RSV F vaccine against medically-significant RSV lower respiratory tract infection (LRTI), as defined by hypoxemia or tachypnea at rest, through the first 90, 120, 150, and 180 days of life in infants.

primaryOutcome.measure: Infants: Percentages of Participants With Medically Significant RSV LRTI With Either Hypoxemia (SpO2 <95% at Sea Level or <92% at Altitudes >1800 Meters) or Tachypnea

effectByArm.arm: Adjuvanted RSV F Vaccine (120 Âµg RSVF Protein Adsorbed to a 0.4 mg Dose of Aluminum)
